channel.title: Menu Options/Actions
channel.description:
Today is the last day before I go back to school after holidays and out of a combination of boredom and intrigue I decided to see if I could resurrect a small project I was working on before I stopped taking an interest in the client.
The only thing right now that is still screwy is when I am attempting to handle a "menu" in runescape.
Previously, there were two String[] in the client (or, before that two StringWrapper[]) that were commonly referred to as "menuOptions" and "menuActions" and when parsed appropriately together these two fields allowed you to reconstruct the menu.
However, it appears that in more recent revisions (I'm not sure how recent), these fields have either been removed or are no longer in use by the cheating scene. My updater can't find them which surprised me but I also realized that could just mean a broken "hook". So, I went to view some other updater outputs, and realized it wasn't in anyones. However I did notice something which i believe to be new, the accessors called "getMenuOption" and "getMenuAction" which both return a String.
My question is simple really, what happened to them, and what can I use as an alternative?

item.title: Menu Options/Actions
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:4, topic:323769”]menuItemList?? you can call it whatever you want, really. it’s a static deque (nodelist) in the client. in #578 i believe it’s field hg.j.[/quote]Alright cheers, ill look into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Menu Options/Actions
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

menuItemList?? you can call it whatever you want, really. it’s a static deque (nodelist) in the client. in #578 i believe it’s field hg.j.

Read full topic

item.title: Menu Options/Actions
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:2, topic:323769”]instead of all of the arrays they encapsulate all of that data and store it in a list. you’ll just have to find that class as well as the list that holds the menu nodes to do what you want to do.[/quote]Is there anymore you can tell me about this “list”? Has it been given a name?

Read full topic

item.title: Menu Options/Actions
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

instead of all of the arrays they encapsulate all of that data and store it in a list. you’ll just have to find that class as well as the list that holds the menu nodes to do what you want to do.

Read full topic
